task.title: Edit vertex
task.shortdesc: You can use the Edit Vertices option to modify individual polyline vertices. When you select this option, the programswitches into a special vertexediting mode and places an xon the first vertex. The xindicates the vertexyou are editing. The Next and Previous options move the xto the next or previous vertex. You can edit only one vertexat a time.

context.p: When editing vertices, you can modify the polyline in the following ways:

ul.li: Convert a polyline segment into a curve by specifying a new tangent angle.
Break a polyline into two separate polylines.
Insert a new vertexafter the current vertex.
Straighten the polyline segment between two vertices.
Change the width of the polyline segment between two vertices.

step.cmd: Choose Modify > Object > Polyline from the mainmenu.
On the command line, type E (Edit vertex).
On the command line, type N (Next). Repeat until the X maker reaches the vertex you want to move.
On the command line, type M (Move).
Specify the new location for the made vertex.
On the command line, type another option, or type Exit to complete the command.
On the command line, type another option, or press Enter to complete the command.

result.p: Select the polyline (A), move the current vertex marker to the vertex you want to move (B), and then specify the new vertex location (C)
To taper the width of an individual polyline segment

ol.li: Choose Modify > Object > Polyline from the mainmenu.
On the command line, type E (Edit vertex).
On the command line, type N (Next). Repeat until the X maker reaches the first vertex of the segment you want to taper.
On the command line, type W (Width).
On the command line, type another option, or type Exit to complete the command.
On the command line, type another option, or press Enter to complete the command.

result.p: Select the polyline (A), move the current vertex marker to the first vertex of the segment you want to taper (B), and then specify the new starting and ending widths for that segment.
